name: UpdateFileSystemShortcut
description:
Update a file system shortcut in a project.

Use this tool to modify the details of an existing file system shortcut within a specified project on Datadog. Useful for adjusting configurations or updating linked resources.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project you want to access. Retrieve it by calling /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: file_system_shortcut_id
parameters.description: A UUID identifying the file system shortcut to be updated.

parameters.name: shortcut_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the file system shortcut to be updated. This ID specifies which shortcut will have its details modified.

parameters.name: shortcut_path
parameters.description: The file path for the shortcut to be updated. This should specify the exact location within the file system where the shortcut is located.

parameters.name: shortcut_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the file system shortcut, such as 'symbolic' or 'hard'.

parameters.name: reference_identifier
parameters.description: The reference identifier for the file system shortcut to be updated. This is a string value required to specify which shortcut you are targeting for the update.

parameters.name: file_system_shortcut_link
parameters.description: The URL or path to link the file system shortcut to. This should be a valid URL or path, depending on the system configuration.

parameters.name: shortcut_creation_date
parameters.description: ISO 8601 format string representing when the shortcut was created.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this file system shortcut.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system shortcut.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
